titleStmt.title: Descriptive Catalogue of the Chinese Manuscripts from Tunhuang in the British Museum [1-1397]
titleStmt.author: Lionel Giles

publicationStmt.publisher: The Trustees of the British Museum

encodingDesc.editorialDecl: Input by Susan Whitfield. Marked up by Sam van Schaik. Latest version imported to 4D on 21 September 2011.

head.p: This electonic version of Lionel Giles' catalogue is a work in progress, and so far consists of entries from 1 to 1397.
* (asterisk) (before title) – indicates start of the text in question is missing
* (asterisk) (after title) – indicates that text is incomplete or the end missing
[ ] (square brackets) (around title) – indicates that the title is not found on the manuscript itself
MS. – manuscript, but generally refers here to handwriting. Giles scales the quality of the handwriting from ‘Fine MS.’ (the best) to ‘Very bad MS.’ (the worst).
For a full introduction please go to seeIntroduction to Giles catalogue.

note.p: 太宗文皇帝製 Preface to the Buddhist canon by the emperor Taizong of the Tang dynasty. K.I.1,f.2. Begin. Only. Mediocre MS. Crisp yellow paper. Early 8th cent. (?).
Preface to the Buddhist canon by the emperor Taizong of the Tang dynasty. K.I.1,f.2. End only.
Da Tang huang di shu sheng ji'. Note made by the Tang emperor Taizong. K.I.1,f.4. Begin. only. Marked 兌 (for 閱 "examined"). Fairly good MS. Buff paper. 8th cent. (?).

Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, pt. 1, ch. 1, pin 1 (1): With preface and note by the Emperor Taizong (cf. 1, 2(2)). At end: (1) black stamp: 三界寺藏經 "Library of the Sanjie monastery"; (2) 僧法濟勘了 "Collated by the priest Faji"; (3) 盧談 "Lu Tan" [copyist?]. Good MS. of early 8th cent. Yellow paper. The first two sheets added in a later hand. With roller and yellow silk band. Outside after title: 一一界 "First [roll in the] first [bundle, San]jie [Monastery]".
Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, pt. 1, ch. 3, pin 2 (1). Before the title: 元本未勘 'Original text not yet collated'. Slightly holed at begin. Mediocre MS. Light buff paper.
Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, pt. 1, ch. 5, pin 3. Preceded by 2 columns of notes, brushed out.
6 columns of another Buddhist text.

Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, pt. 1, ch. 5, pin 3 (2). Begin. Slightly torn. The first three sheets have been added in another hand. Signature/colophon. Fine MS. Of early 8th cent.(?). Yellowish oiled paper.

msItem.title: 大般若波羅蜜多經
Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra (unplaced fragments)

note.p: (in an inferior hand [from recto]). A note [colophon], probably of ownership.

msItem.colophon: 維大唐乾符六年正月十三日沙州燉煌縣學士張
Zhang, student in the Dunhuang district of Shazhou, on the 13th day of the 1st month in the 6th year of Qianfu of the Great Tang dynasty' [7 February 879].

Pin 77 is entitled 攝取眾生, and pin 78 拔出眾生, but they agree with the corresponding pin of the Canon, though with different names. Note after title of each pin: 此放光經有廿卷合九十品 'This Fang guang sutra is divided into 20 chapters, comprising 90 pin'. Note at end. Very good MS. of 7th cent. Good brownish-yellow paper.

note.p: *[Fo shuo mian yi zhang zhe zi suo wen jing]. About one third wanting. Clear but sprawling schoolboy hand. Colophon. The cyclical date 'gengyin' does not agree. 庚 'geng' is written without its final stroke. The text corresponds to N.769, K. XV. 1 bbb, T.544, though it is there said to have been translated in the period AD 500-515. Good, dull buff paper.

光贊摩訶般若波羅蜜經

note.p: Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikāprajñap﻿āramitasūtra 光贊摩訶般若破羅蜜〔經〕 *Guang zan mo he ban ruo bo luo mi [jing]* Nine loose leaves, two with writing R and V, including one with indication of pin 13. Two others form an outer cover, on the back of which is written 經零在內 'sutra fragments within'. Good MS. Stiff buff paper.

msItem.title: Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikāprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.4; K.V.4a; T.222)

金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: *Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra. Good MS. Crisp yellow paper. With tabulated colophon. Notes 12 sheet of paper, 10 remain.

msItem.colophon: 咸亨三年五月十九日左春坊楷書吳元禮寫用麻紙十二張潢手解善集 …

Copied on the 19th of the 5th moon of the 3rd year of Xianheng (19 June 672) by Wu Yuanli, writer in the clerkly style attached to the left division of the Crown Prince's staff. 12 sheet of hemp paper used. Mounter and dyer, Xie Shanzhi. Three revisions all by Xiaoyi. The text was minutely perused by Shenfu, Jiashang, the active director Huili, and the spiritual director Daocheng, all of the Taiyuan Monastery. The panguan was Xiang Yigan and the general superintendent Yu Chang, a high official at Chang'an.

note.p: 佛說金剛般若經 *Fo shuo jin gang ban ruo jing. Good MS. of 7th cent. Brownish paper.

msItem.title: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.10; K.V.6c; T.235)
金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: *Jin gang ban ruo bo luo mi jing. Very good MS. Bright yellow paper. First sheet added in a different hand. Colophon. Empress Wu characters in the colophon 聖，年，月，日，國.

msItem.colophon: 聖曆三年五月廿三日大升拔谷副使上柱國南陽縣開國公陰仁協寫經為金輪聖神皇帝及七世父母合家大小得六品發願月別許寫一卷得五品月別寫經兩卷久為征行末辦紙墨不從本願今辦寫得普為一切轉讀。

On the 23rd day of the fifth month of Shengli 3 [14 June 700] Yin Renxie, Assistant Commissioner at Dashengbagu, 'shangzhuguo', and 'kaiguogong' of Nanyang district, had this sutra copied on behalf of the Holy and Divine Sovereign Lord of the Golden Wheel [i. e. the Empress Wu], his own parents of seven previous incarnations, and all the members of his family, great and small. He made a vow that if he was promoted to the sixth grade he would have one roll copied every month, and that if he was promoted to the fifth grade he would have two rolls of a sutra copied every month. But for a long time, owing to warlike operations, paper and ink have not been procurable, so that he did not fulfil his vow. Now at last, materials having been procured, he has been able to have this copy made, to be unrolled and read by all without exception.

金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: *Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra. Very good MS. Crisp yellow paper. With tabuated colophon dated 'The 11th of the intercalary 3rd moon of the 3rd year of Shangyuan' [29 April, 676]. The copyist was Ouyang Xuanzhe, and 12 sheets of paper were used. The panguan (judge) was Li De, and the general superintendent Yan Xuandao. In other respects the colophon is similar to that of Or.8210/S.36. Verso: part of colophon repeated.

msItem.colophon: Copied on the eleventh of the intercalary third month of Shangyuan 3 [29 April 676] by Ouyang Xuanzhe, writer in the clerkly style, attached to the left division of the Crown Prince's staff. 12 sheets of paper were used. Mounter and dyer, Xie Shanji. The three revisions were all done by Xiao Yi. The text was minutely perused by Shenfu, Jiashang, the active director Huili and the spiritual director Daocheng, all of the Taiyuan Monastery. The judge was Li De. The general superintendent was Yan Xuandao.

msItem.colophon: 弟子令狐為龍王行病鬼王怨家債主敬造像二區寫金剛般若一百部法華一部於靈安寺壽禪師院內潔凈寫

The disciple Linghu has reverently caused two images to be made, and a hundred copies of the 'Jin gang ban ruo' and one section of the 'Fa hua' to be prepared, for the benefit of the Dragon King, the King of the disease-circulating demons, and his own enemies and creditors [of a former existence]. Copied after purification, in the Court of the Dhyana Master Shou at the Ling'an Monastery.

Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra copied on behalf of my deceased daughter Momohexian and grandson Zhu[?], that they may speedily obtain bodily emancipation and a release from suffering.

msItem.title: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.10; K.V.6c; T.235)
金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: *Fo shuo jin gang ban ruo jing. Begin. mtd. Good MS. Thin, light yellow paper. Colophon (in the same hand).

msItem.colophon: 大隋大業十二年七月廿三日清信優婆夷劉圓淨敬寫此經以茲微善願為一切眾生轉讀聞者敬信皆悟苦空見者受持俱勝[?for 昇]常樂又願劉身早離邊荒速還京輦罪障消除福慶?集

On the 23rd of the seventh month of Day 12 in the Great Sui dynasty [9 Sept., 616] the female lay devotee [upasika] Liu Yuanjing reverently caused a copy of this sutra to be made, praying that by this slight act of merit all those who hear it when read aloud may reverently believe and awaken to the unreality of suffering, and that those who read it may bear its precepts in mind and rise to enduring felicity. She also prays that she herself may soon quit this desert frontier region and speedily return to the Imperial capital; that the barriers of her sin may be broken down, and that manifold blessings may descend upon her.

note.p: Begin. mtd. Fairly good MS. On a roller. Good smooth buff paper. The cols are not ruled but indicated by creases. Colophon.

msItem.colophon: 佛弟子王超敬寫上為七代父母下及妻女拜大地蠢勤眾生悉願離苦解脫捨邪歸正皆發菩提心常聞佛聞法

Reverently copied by the Buddhist disciple Wang Chao, firstly, on behalf of his parents of seven previous incarnations, and secondly, for the benefit of his [deceased] wife and daughter, as well as the wriggling and moving creatures of the whole earth, praying that all living things may obtain release from suffering and emancipation from the body, reject the false and return to the true, all acquire profound intelligence and constantly hear the Law of Buddha.

梁朝傅大士頌金剛經 Liang chao fu da shi song jin gang jing. The Diamond Sūtra, with preface and 49 eulogies by the Mahāsattva Fu of the Liang dynasty interspersed. 32 secs., complete. Further eulogies and dhāraṇī are added at the end. Fairly good MS. of the 9th cent. (?). Thick whitish-grey paper.

note.p: 金剛般若波羅蜜經 Jin gang ban ruo po luo mi jing. 32 secs. With introductory matter (begin, imperfect) and prayer. At end: 西川過家真印本 'From the true printed text of the Guo family in XiChuan'. Dhāraṇī. Colophon: l'. Mediocre MS. Booklet of 29 ff.

msItem.colophon: 天祐二年歲次乙丑四年廿三日八十二老人手寫此經流傅信士
On the 23rd of the 4th moon of the yichou year, the 2nd of Tianyu [29 May, 905], an old man aged 82 copied this sutra with his own hand for transmission to the faithful.

note.p: *Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra. 32 secs. Fairly good MS. of about AD 900. Booklet of 62 ff. (13 coloured yellow, the rest whitish).

msItem.title: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.10; K.V.6c; T.235)
金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra, 32 secs. ff.1-44R (多 is wrongly inserted in the title on the cover and on f.6 r). Preceded by prayers, dhāraṇī, and pen-and-ink drawings of four Bodhisattvas and the Four Lokapāla (Guardians) (bis) ; followed by dhāraṇī. Colophon. Fairly good MS. Thick whitish buff paper. A well preserved booklet of 52 ff. bound with string.

msItem.colophon: 于時大宋乾德七年己巳歲四月十五日大乘賢者兼當學禪錄何江通發心敬為大小經三筑子計九卷盡夜念誦一心供養故記之耳

On the 15th of the 4th moon of the Jixu year, the 7th of Qiande [really the 2nd of Kaibao] in the Great Sung dynasty [4 May,[969], the Mahānayist worthy and Dhyāna recorder in the school, He Jiang Tong, with pious intent reverently copied out three books of sūtras, large and small, amounting to nine chuan, then recited them all night long, and now whole-heartedly dedicates them, making this record of the fact

msItem.title: 佛說摩利支天菩薩陀羅尼經

note.p: 佛說摩利支天菩薩陀羅尼經 Fo shuo mo li zhi tian pu sa tuo luo ni jing, said to have been translated by Bodhiruci, but not in the Canon. ff.44r-46 v. Colophon. Fairly good MS. Thick whitish buff paper. A well preserved booklet of 52 ff. bound with string.

msItem.title: 佛說齋法凊淨經 Fo shuo zhai fa qing jing jing. Apocryphal sutre. ff 46 v-52 r. Colophon'.

msItem.colophon: 寫一切怨家債主所有汚泥伽藍一切重罪悉得銷
[Copied] on behalf of all enemies and creditors, so that all impurity and the heavy sins of the Monastery may be entirely wiped away

msItem.title: 佛說閆羅王受記合匹衆逆脩生七齋功德往士經

note.p: 佛說閆羅王受記合匹衆逆脩生七齋功德往士經 Fo shuo yan luo wang shou ji he pi chang ni xiu sheng qi zhai gong de wang sheng jing. An apocryphal sutra [K.Supp. C. XXIII, 4 (9).] ff.19-24 r. Booklet of 24 ff. Indifferent MS. of 10th cent. Buff paper.

msItem.colophon: 一切怨家債主領受功德
All enemies and creditors receive the merit [acquired by copying this sutra]

msItem.colophon: 時天復五年歲次乙丑三月一日寫竟信心受持老八十有二
Copying completed on the 1st of the 3rd moon of yi-chou, the 5th year of Tianfu (really the 2nd of Tianyu: 8 April 905]. Apprehended and borne in mind with a trustful heart by an old man of 82.

msItem.colophon: 天祐三年丙演二月二日八十三老人手自刺血寫之
Copied by an old man of 83, who pricked his own hand to draw blood [to write with], on the 2nd day of the 2nd moon of bingyan, the 3rd year of Tianyu [27 Feb. 906].

msItem.title: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.10; K.V.6c; T.235)

note.p: *Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra, (1) sec *17-32. At end: 西川戈 （？for過）家真印本 'From the true printed text of the Ge [?Guo] family in XiChuan' [Cf. 1355, 1358, 1376, 1378, 1388, 1389]. Followed by dhāraṇī . (2) Indifferent MS. Booklet of 15ff. Coarse buff paper. [Title on 15V]

msItem.colophon: 奉為老耕牛神生淨土彌勒下生同在初會俱聞聖法

Humbly on behalf of my old ploughing ox, that is soul may be reborn in the Pure Land, and that when Maitreya is born on earth [as Buddha] it may participate in his first assembly, where all shall hear the Holy Law

msItem.title: 佛說閆羅王受記經

note.p: 佛說閆羅王受記經 Fo shuo yan luo wang shou ji jing. An apocryphal sutra, corresponding partially to K. Supp. C. XXIII 4(9). Longer title at begin. : see 1372 (2). Colophon [? A.D. 911]. ff.10-15R.. Indifferent MS. Booklet of 15ff. Coarse buff paper.

msItem.colophon: 奉為老耕牛一 頭敬寫金剛一卷受記一卷願此牛身領受功德往生淨土再莫受畜生身天曹地府分明分付莫令更有雔訟 辛未年正月

On behalf of one old ploughing ox I have reverently copied out the Diamond [sutra] in 1 chain and the shou chi in 1 juan, praying that this ox may personally receive the merit therefrom, and be reborn in the Pure Land, never again to come to this life in the body of a domestic animal. May this be clearly ordained by the officers dispensing justice in the underworld, so that there may be no further enmity or quarrel [between the ox and the owner]. In the first moon of the xinwei year.

note.p: *Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra, sec. 20 (end)-26(title only). Indifferent MS. of 10th cent. 2 leaves of a booklet (the first slightly mtd).

msItem.title: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.10; K.V.6c; T.235)
金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: *Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra, sec *28-32. At begin: A coloured drawing of Vajrapāṇi, and prayers. At end: 西川過家印真本 'From the true printed text of the Guo family in Xichuan'. Dhāraṇī. Mediocre MS. Buff paper, brittle and discoloured. 6 leaves of a booklet. Note: RAMAN spectroscopy on the ink revealed no traces of blood, but it may be too diluted to detect easily.

msItem.colophon: 天祐三年丙寅二月三日八十三老人刺左手中指出血以香墨寫此金經流傅信心人一無所願本性實空無有願樂

On the 3rd of the 2nd moon of ping-yin, the 3rd year of Tianyu [28 Feb., 906] an old man of 83 pricked the middle finger of his left hand so as to draw blood, with which he mixed fragrant ink and copied out this Jin [gang] jing for transmission to men to believing heart. There is nothing for which he wishes to pray, his nature having attained absolute vacuity, free from any desire for pleasure.

note.p: Part of a gatha from an unidentified sutra which has been cut up to make a folding booklet of 4 leaves.

msItem.title: Vajracchedik﻿āprajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.10; K.V.6c; T.235)
金剛般若波羅密經

note.p: *Vajracchedika-Prajñap﻿āramitasūtra (in 32 pins), pin29 (end)-31 (begin.), 32 (end). At end: 西川過家印真本 'From the true text belonging to the Guo family in Xichuan'. Dhāraṇī. Colophon: [17 Jan., 906, Tianfu being a mistake for Tianyu. Cf. 1355, 1376, 1378, 1388.] Mediocre MS. Yellow paper discoloured. Verso: Part of a gāthā from another sūtra which has been cut up to make a folding booklet of 4 leaves.

msItem.colophon: 天復二年乙丑十二月廿日八十二老人手寫流傅
Copied for transmission by an old man of 82 with his own hand on the 20th of the 12th moon of yichou, the 2nd year of Tianfu.

佛說仁王護國般若波羅蜜經 *Fo shuo ren wang hu guo ban ruo po luo mi jing, ch. 1, pin 2-4. Very good MS. of late 6th cent. Thin orange-yellow paper.

msItem.title: Prajñap﻿āramitasūtra (N.17; K.V.6j; T.245)
仁王般若波羅蜜經

note.p: [*Prajñap﻿āramitasūtra] p'in 5 (end only)-8. Colophon: Very good MS. Yellow paper.

msItem.colophon: 大代建明二年四月十五日佛弟子元榮既居末劫生死是累離鄉已久歸慕常心是以身及妻子奴婢六畜悉用為比沙門天王布施三寶以銀錢千文贖錢一千文贖身及妻子一千文贖奴婢一千文贖六畜入法之錢用造經願天王成佛弟子家眷奴婢六畜滋盆長命及至菩提悉蒙還闕所願如是

On the 15th of the 4th moon of the 2nd year of Jian ming of the Great Tai [I.e. Wei] dynasty [16 May, 531], the Buddhist lay disciple Yuan Rong, since he lives in danger of his life, has long been parted from his home and has a constant longing to return, therefore in his own person and that of his wife and children, his male and female servants, and his domestic animals, makes on behalf of the Celestial King Vaiśramaṇa a donation to the Triratana of the sum of a thousand silver cash; and as ransom money, a thousand cash to ransom himself and his wife and children, a thousand cash to ransom his servants, and a thousand cash to ransom his animals. The money thus paid to the Church is to be used for copying sūtras, with the prayer that the Celestial King may become a Buddha, and that the disciple's family, servants and live-stock may be richly endowed with the blessing of long life, may attain enlightenment, and may all be permitted to return to the capital. This is his prayer.

note.p: *Prajñap﻿āramitasūtra. ch. 2 (end only). The text differs slightly from that of the Canon. Very good MS. of 6th cent. Thin whitish paper.
